isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992-1993 - DESCRIPTION

item.para: Provides operation descriptions of International installed components and related circuits that work with the Detroit Diesel Electronic Engine Controls (DDEC).
Provides circuit diagrams and connector end views for the International circuits and connectors.

Does not provide engine diagnostics, but does provide step-by-step troubleshooting guides for International installed circuits and components. These troubleshooting guides should be used when the Detroit Diesel Diagnostic Manual indicates a problem may be present in a International circuit or component.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: The Detroit Diesel Series 60 is an electronically controlled, mechanically actuated, unit injected diesel engine. The Detroit Diesel Electronic Control (DDEC) system provides an electronic fuel control system, electronic engine protection and other operational controls.
DDEC is standard on Series 60 engines and controls the following functions:

item.para: Automatic Idle Shutdown Timer (3 To 100 Minutes)

svcproc.para: Refer to the Detroit Diesel Manual furnished with the vehicle for additional information.

Since each Series 60 DDEC system is electronically programmable to individual owner specifications, the operating parameters will vary from vehicle to vehicle. These parameters include: maximum cruise speed, maximum road speed setting, and many others.
